content.description: Start on left side of the Main wall (right of Hourglass and left of Foreign Invasion)and aim for a short vertical crack about 15 ft. up. Climb up then step right to the horizontal letterbox. Set good gear then diagonal up and right to above A Year in the Life. Set anchors or top out and walkoff right. My favorite climb at Allamuchy.
content.protection: Wires and small cams, tcu's. Double up at first crack and at the letterbox. I think there is a gear placement before you reach the anchor point but not positive. Set a gear anchor above Year  in the Life.
content.location: Starts just to the left of Foreign Invasion and to the right of Hourglass. Look for the short vertical crack about 15ft. up. The route basically diagonalls up and right across the Main Face.

content.description: Start up the slab to a small overlap, then continue up to a roof. pull the roof in the center and continue on easier thin slab climbing. Look up and left for a left facing corner with hand crack, adds one last good move to the climb.
content.protection: gear, no anchor. plenty of trees up top for TR anchors.
content.location: On the far left side of the main wall. starting behind a tree at the base and below 2 roofs.

content.description: Traverse main wall in either direction
Begin at a vertical crack about 6 feet left of Foreign Invasion. Climb through the hourglass crack formation, then past several small corners to top.
content.protection: Crash pad to protect fall before jesus nut.

content.description: Start at a small, left facing corner and climb the face past a bolt to a small horizontal crack. Continue to the top.
content.protection: Gear higher up is better then it looks. Be careful on the exciting runout just above the first bolt because a fall could definitely result in decking. Bring small cams and nuts.

content.description: Start: Find Easiest way up arete/corner system to the left of "A Touch to Much". Climb up to the left of the upper face of "A.T.T.M". continue up to wide ledge above the face of "A.T.T.M" and set up a TR for "A.T.T.M". Climb can continue to top.
content.protection: Depending on leaders reach, bottom could be R/X. Upper half of climb is rated G
content.location: To descend down climb to ledge above the main face and rap or descend down the ramp back to the bottom

content.description: Steep face just right of right facing corner. Gear is useful above bolt. There used to be 2 bolts, but now there is only 1.

climbs.name: A Year in the Life, Variation 2, Left Start

content.description: Begin several feet left of the direct start, then climb delicately up and right on small holds. After reaching first bolt or bolt hole, proceed up.
content.protection: Usually top roped, but if bolts were replaced, small cams and nuts can be useful above the last bolt.

climbs.name: A Year in the Life, Variation 1 Direct Start

content.description: Climb the very blank face straight up to the first bolt hole without using any good holds on or near the corner to the right. Head for next bolt hole and to top.
content.protection: Bolts may have been replaced, but usually top roped. Small cams and nuts useful above last bolt if being led.

content.description: Approach a now missing bolt from good holds on the right. Traverse left onto a blank face, away from any good holds on the right. Head for the next bolt hole, then towards the tp. Small cams and nuts useful above the former last bolt.
content.protection: Bolts may have been replaced, but top rope anchors exist.

content.description: Walk 20 feet right from the right end of the Right wall and up the hill 30 feet to a rear wall, south facing, with a small tree growing out of the face. Climb to top, staying right of tree.
Double crack at extreme right end of Right wall.
Arete to left of right facing corner
Traverse from left to right under overhangs.
content.location: To the left of Main Wall, the base of the cliff rises and the rock is less steep. After about 30 feet, large right slanting overhangs can be seen.

content.description: Left most crack, just right of Blow Out

Start is about 5 feet left of a tree at the base of the climb and immediately to the right of 5.5 (Main Wall). The first few moves are tricky. Climb straight up the face between two right facing corners. Top out either at the first ledge just right of the 5.5 (Main Wall) anchors or continue up another 15 feet or so to the tree.
content.protection:
PG rated

 For top roping, you can either build a gear anchor on the same ledge but to the right of the 5.5 (Main Wall) anchors, or on the ledge above. The ledge above has options for cam placements and there is a tree as an option. I would suggest relying mostly on gear as the tree appears to be unhealthy.

content.description: Climb the face, staying left of hourglass at all times.
Arete just left of a right facing corner, left of 5.5.
Climb up through a notch in the overhang about 12 feet left of Hourglass.
Climb a tiered, right facing corner system that begins 12' above the ground.
Right facing corner separating Right Wall from Main Wall.
Starting under the right end of the overhangs, climb easily up, step right, then up easy slabs to the top. Stay away from the overhangs.
content.location: To the left of Main Wall, the base f the cliff rises and the rock is less steep. After about 30 feet, some large, right slanting overhangs can be seen.

content.description:
After a few hours of messing around wish aid gear on the choss boulders, Tim and I decided to try and aid a route up the main face of allamuchy. 

  Start in between routes 16 and 17 in the Rock Climbing New Jersey Book at a nut/cam hook placement. C1 up a few placements to an easy (5.2) blockly section. Continue up corner on aid using gear and hook moves to top. Free climb/scramble to ledge.
content.protection: Cam hooks   seam hooks   small nuts    small cams

content.description: Allamuchy's largest cliff, featuring 16 routes and 2 variations. The main wall is between 35 and 60 feet and the right wall is 30 feet tall.
